meanings.definition: A border or edging along a pavement or road.
meanings.sent1: The kerbing along the sidewalk was painted white for visibility.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed new kerbing to separate the road from the grass.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids pretended the kerbing was a balance beam during recess.
meanings.sent4: The kerbing acted like a protective shield, keeping the flowers safe from passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow kerbing made the street look neat and organized.

meanings.definition: The act of providing or installing a kerb.
meanings.sent1: The kerbing of the new neighborhood was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: His job involved overseeing the kerbing of various streets in the city.
meanings.sent3: The team celebrated the successful kerbing with a pizza party.
meanings.sent4: She considered the kerbing of her garden a personal accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The kerbing project brought a sense of unity to the community.

meanings.definition: To provide or install a kerb.
meanings.sent1: The city will kerb the main road next week for safety reasons.
meanings.sent2: They kerbed the parking lot to prevent cars from driving onto the grass.
meanings.sent3: The company decided to kerb the entire building to enhance its appearance.
meanings.sent4: She kerbed her garden with colorful stones to add a decorative touch.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew kerbing the street worked diligently under the hot sun.
